description: It is prudent to diversify systematically among stocks and bonds for the long haul. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Having a mixture of stocks and bonds is still the best bet
title_page: Having a mixture of stocks and bonds is still the best bet | The Straits Times
maintext:
It isn’t dead. It’s more important than ever. I’m talking about the 60/40 portfolio, which has sometimes been considered the living heart of investing.
Those specific numbers – which refer to 60 per cent stocks and 40 per cent bonds as core investment holdings – aren’t significant. They are merely a convenient starting point for thinking about investing and not an exact, general purpose prescription for everyone. Nor have they ever been.
